answerText: beta oxidation [prompt on fatty acid oxidation][10] This molecule is required to traffic fatty acids across the mitochondrial membrane. A namesake palmitoyltransferase transfers a fatty acid moiety from the thiol of coenzyme A to the hydroxyl on this molecule in the first of three steps for shuttling fatty acids across.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 10 | 20 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Malonyl-CoA downregulates this process because it blocks fatty acids from crossing the mitochondrial membrane. [10] Identify this mitochondrial pathway that breaks down fatty acids to form acetyl-CoA.
